revision.text:
{{Infobox Dotcom company | company_name = DataStax | company_type = [[Privately held company|Private]] | location_city = [[San Mateo, CA]] | location_country = [[USA]] | foundation = 2010 | key_people = Billy Bosworth (CEO)
Jonathan Ellis (Co-Founder)
Matt Pfeil (Co-Founder) | industry = [[Database Technologies]] | homepage = [http://www.DataStax.com DataStax.com] }} '''DataStax, Inc.''' is a computer software company based in [[San Mateo, California]]. DataStax distributes and supports a version of [[Apache Cassandra]]. Cassandra is a [[NoSQL]] Database Management System whose features include scalability, fault tolerance, and support for CQL which the company claims is "close to a subset" of the widely-used [[SQL]] language.http://www.datastax.com/dev/blog/what%E2%80%99s-new-in-cassandra-0-8-part-1-cql-the-cassandra-query-language{{Self-published inline|date=January 2013}} DataStax employees contribute to the open-source Cassandra project http://wiki.apache.org/cassandra/Committers Apache Cassandra Wiki http://www.infoworld.com/t/database-administration/cassandra-12-database-better-geared-fat-servers-210072 and DataStax's business model involves adding value by supplying tools and services which are intended to make Cassandra easier to use and administer. The company's two founders, Matt Pfeil and Jonathan Ellis, were employees of [[Rackspace]]. They left Rackspace in 2010 to found DataStax (original name: Riptano). http://www.informationweek.com/hardware/virtualization/riptano-offers-cassandra-commercial-supp/224600336 http://www.networkworld.com/community/blog/datastax-wants-make-cassandra-best-nosql-them By late 2012 the company had acquired over $20 million in funding from venture capital firms ,http://www.forbes.com/sites/tomtaulli/2012/10/03/datastax-wants-a-pound-of-flesh-from-oracle/ and acquired customers including [[Netflix]] and [[Pearson Education]]. http://www.dbms2.com/2012/03/21/datastax-enterprise-2-0 http://www.forbes.com/sites/tomtaulli/2012/10/03/datastax-wants-a-pound-of-flesh-from-oracle/http://techblog.netflix.com/2011/01/nosql-at-netflix.html DataStax has been described as one of the "leading" or "dominating" vendors in the NoSQL database management system categoryhttp://www.techweb.com/news/240144124/13-big-data-vendors-to-watch-in-2013.htmlhttp://jaxenter.com/could-cassandra-be-the-first-breakout-nosql-database-44849.htmlhttp://online.wsj.com/article/PR-CO-20130115-909630.html?mod=crnews though according to a 2012 estimate it had fewer customers than competitors [[10gen]] and [[Couchbase]].http://blogs.the451group.com/information_management/2012/05/30/a-different-perspective-on-nosql-vendor-traction/ The company's "Community Edition" is a free distribution of Apache Cassandra along with a utility named OpsCenter.http://www.eweek.com/database/apache-cassandra-based-datastax-community-edition-1.2-launches/http://www.zdnet.com/datastax-1-2-on-windows-a-guided-tour_p9-7000010053/ The company's "Enterprise Edition" integrates Cassandra with other Apache projects such as [[Hadoop]].http://www.theregister.co.uk/2011/03/23/cassandra_mashed_with_hadoop/ and allows searches using [[Solr]].http://www.theregister.co.uk/2012/03/22/datastax_enterprise_cassandra_2_0/ http://www.drdobbs.com/open-source/datastax-manages-big-data-trio-real-time/232700037 ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * {{Official website|http://www.datastax.com}} [[Category:Companies based in San Mateo, California]] [[Category:NoSQL]]
